newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Plains cattle trade slow at $70 - feedlots.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Plains cattle trade slow at $70 - feedlots.

text.p: U.S. Plains feedlot cattle sales Monday were slow, with light trade reported at $70.00 per cwt, steady with last week, feedlot sources said.

About 2,000 head traded in the Texas Panhandle/western Oklahoma area and near 2,800 in Kansas, USDA said. Also in Kansas, about 400 head of top quality cattle were sold at $71.00 for delivery against Chicago Mercantile Exchange live cattle futures, according to USDA.
Many Texas feedlot managers were attending the Texas Cattle Feeders Association annual meeting in Houston, which runs through Tuesday, sources there said.
